item.title: Cookie Tossing
item.description: TIL about the term cookie tossing, an attack leverages the feature that a subdomain can put a key=value pair in a cookie which can then also be read by the domain above it. For example, todayilearned.dev doesn’t know if this key comes from it or from cookie.todayilearned.dev. This becomes problematic when a website allows untrusted people to host subdomains under its domain. They can then abuse this feature to write manipulated cookie information.
